Waliku addresses challenges of school-communities in low resource contexts to recognize and act on critical student absences, illnesses and concerns in a timely manner. Schools need tools like Waliku to know they have been effective in bringing students back and respond to those who have not returned. In order to be accessible to many schools, Waliku is diversifying its solution and scaling, initially in Kabupaten Sumba Barat and Bandung, followed by other locations in Eastern Indonesia and West Java. S/he will adhere to child safeguarding and data privacy policies of Waliku, Save the Children and Government of Indonesia. A MEAL Data Analyst will support the Waliku Global Team’s efforts with making Waliku a more customizable solution and in digitally linking schools with other service providers in the community. The role of this person will be to contribute to the upgrades in the database, maintain a district education dashboard, and develop tools and dashboards that allow links between schools, clinics and child welfare providers.
